# DocSearch Crawler Best/Worst Practices (Docusaurus)

## Best
- Use `sitemaps` for discovery
- Extract headings via `.theme-doc-markdown h1..h4`
- Keep `searchableAttributes` ordered from hierarchy to content
- Set `attributesForFaceting` (e.g., `lang`, `area`) if needed
- Exclude noise with `stop_urls` (tags/search/privacy etc.)

## Worst
- Crawling with generic selectors that miss headings
- Indexing low-value pages (changelog/privacy)
- Putting `content` before hierarchy in `searchableAttributes`
- Missing `sitemaps` / unrestricted start_urls

## Example (Good)
```json
{
  "start_urls": ["https://docs.example.com"],
  "sitemaps": ["https://docs.example.com/sitemap.xml"],
  "selectors": {
    "lvl1": ".theme-doc-markdown h1",
    "lvl2": ".theme-doc-markdown h2",
    "lvl3": ".theme-doc-markdown h3",
    "text": ".theme-doc-markdown p, .theme-doc-markdown li"
  },
  "custom_settings": {
    "searchableAttributes": [
      "unordered(hierarchy.lvl1)",
      "unordered(hierarchy.lvl2)",
      "unordered(hierarchy.lvl3)",
      "content"
    ]
  }
}
```

## Example (Bad)
```json
{
  "start_urls": ["https://docs.example.com"],
  "selectors": { "text": "body *" }
}
```

## Checklist
- [ ] Headings captured (lvl1..lvl3)
- [ ] Noise excluded
- [ ] Hierarchy prioritized
- [ ] Rate limit set for large sites
- [ ] i18n/tag facets configured if applicable
